alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 7:01PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Smith, northeastern Phillips and southern Franklin Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 701 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Naponee, or 17 miles northeast of Phillipsburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Naponee around 720 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bloomington and Franklin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
